channel.title: Changing what Character Rights mean
channel.description:
How do i make it so that character rights =2 is silver crown and 1 is just member?
Because on my server i want 1 to be members and 1 is a silver crown

item.title: Changing what Character Rights mean
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

[quote=“omgxitsxcody, post:8, topic:244335”][quote author=f1rey wav3 link=topic=320706.msg2538209#msg2538209 date=1226862450]
NOOO

Thats not what i mean

I mean how do i change it so that when your characterRights = 2 your a silver crown (gold crown atm) and

When your characterRights =1 you are not a silver crown
[/quote]

I think you’re a bit confused.

If you want to just make someone a member, and not have them be any part of staff (mod, admin, etc.)
Then in Characters…
Click on the person, and change…
character-ismember = 0
to
character-ismember = 1

but, if you want to make someone moderator, you’d change
character-rights = 0
to
character-rights = 1

There’s no way to make character-rights 1 be a member, character rights is pretty much specifically mod, admin, owner, co-owner.[/quote]

Are you people completely stupid…he is not confused about anything…you pepole are confused…he is perfectly fine…unlike you.

and f1rey wav3 it’s client sided…don’t listen to these people…they are stupid.

Read full topic

item.title: Changing what Character Rights mean
item.dc:creator: @omgxitsxcody omgxitsxcody
item.description:
@omgxitsxcody wrote:

[quote=“f1rey wav3, post:6, topic:244335”]NOOO

Thats not what i mean

I mean how do i change it so that when your characterRights = 2 your a silver crown (gold crown atm) and

When your characterRights =1 you are not a silver crown[/quote]

I think you’re a bit confused.

If you want to just make someone a member, and not have them be any part of staff (mod, admin, etc.)
Then in Characters…
Click on the person, and change…
character-ismember = 0
to
character-ismember = 1

but, if you want to make someone moderator, you’d change
character-rights = 0
to
character-rights = 1

There’s no way to make character-rights 1 be a member, character rights is pretty much specifically mod, admin, owner, co-owner.

Read full topic

item.title: Changing what Character Rights mean
item.dc:creator: @da_man1 da man1
item.description:
@da_man1 wrote:

Yes and the one above it is like Character Rights. For mod change the character rights to “1” and then u have a member and a moderator. 1=mod; 2=admin; 3=owner and if you have 5 it may be co-owner

Read full topic
